page.title: 13FELL FOX HUNTING LAMPLUGH
page.content: The fell fox hunting season starts in September and finishes in May. In fell fox hunting you go on foot instead of horse back because you could not go far on horse back. The huntsman meets the farmers and makes a list of places to hunt. Then he starts to do early morning hunts, for these he has to get up at 4.30 am. The huntsman has 45 hounds he takes about 30 to 32 hounds out on a hunt. If a hound has a cold the huntsman does not take it out for another two weeks after its cured. The hounds get fed on porrage and flaked maize. The huntsman mixes the feed in big pots and cooks it in them too. They power the pots by gas. The reason for fell fox hunting is to keep the numbers of foxs down all year and especially in lambing season.
